metadata.Title: CVE-2011-4127 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The Linux kernel before 3.2.2 does not properly restrict SG_IO ioctl calls,which allows local users to bypass intended restrictions on disk read andwrite operations by sending a SCSI command to (1) a partition block deviceor (2) an LVM volume.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-4127` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.2.0-16.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-3.4.0-4-goldfish - 3.4.0-4.27
No subscription required

linux-image-3.4.0-7-mako - 3.4.0-7.40
No subscription required

linux-image-3.4.0-5-flo - 3.4.0-5.22
No subscription required

linux-image-4.2.0-1013-raspi2 - 4.2.0-1013.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1012-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1012.12
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-16.19').
linux-goldfish package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.4.0-4.27').
linux-mako package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.4.0-7.40').
linux-flo package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.4.0-5.22').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-1013.19').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1012.12').
